com.sap.dirigible.ide.logging

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sap.dirigible.ide.logging.Logger

  • public class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the central class used for logging in the Dirigible project.

    This class works as a proxy to a real logging library by delegating calls to it. The idea is that if at any moment a new logging library is used, modifications would be confined only to this class.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void debug(java.lang.String message)
      Log fine-grained information events.
      void debug(java.lang.String message, java.lang.Throwable ex)
      Same as debug(String) with the ability to specify an exception that caused the logging.
      void error(java.lang.String message)
      Log an error that might still allow the application to continue to operate.
      void error(java.lang.String message, java.lang.Throwable ex)
      Same as error(String) with the ability to specify an exception that caused the logging.
      void fatal(java.lang.String message)
      Log a severe error that would most likely lead to an application abort.
      void fatal(java.lang.String message, java.lang.Throwable ex)
      Same as fatal(String) with the ability to specify an exception that caused the logging.
      static Logger getLogger(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
      Shorthand for getLogger(clazz.getName()).
      static Logger getLogger(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a Logger instance that is bound to the specified name.
      void info(java.lang.String message)
      Log an event in the application or progress.
      void info(java.lang.String message, java.lang.Throwable ex)
      Same as info(String) with the ability to specify an exception that caused the logging.
      void trace(java.lang.String message)
      Log the most fine-grained events.
      void trace(java.lang.String message, java.lang.Throwable ex)
      Same as trace(String) with the ability to specify an exception that caused the logging.
      void warn(java.lang.String message)
      Log a potentially harmful situation.

      Same as warn(String) with the ability to specify an exception that caused the logging.

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a Logger instance that is bound to the specified name.

        Usually the name parameter should represent the name of the class that operates on the instance.
